name: 8.14 "What is...Cliff Clavin?" Trivia Game | Television | 10 Questions

questions.text: Who had been coming to Cheers since at least the 1960s?
questions.explanation:
Norm.

	A man came into Cheers and was telling Woody he hadn't been there since the 1960s. He then went on to explain how everything had changed. He then said, "They even changed the paneling" Woody asked where and the man replied, "over there behind Norm".

his little black book.

	Sam first asked the guys if any of them took it. When it turned out they didn't he realized it really was stolen and he had to get it back because a lot of women were calling him angrily and then hanging up on him.

questions.correct: Cliff & Clavin & Cliff Clavin & Clifford & Clifford Clavin
questions.explanation:
Cliff & Clavin & Cliff Clavin & Clifford & Clifford Clavin.

	Being a trivia nut, it was Cliff's dream to be on "Jeopardy". The show came to Boston so he took the test to get on, and he passed it.

questions.text: What did Woody find in the lost and found?
questions.explanation:
his socks.

	Sam had Woody search the lost and found for his little black book. Woody said he didn't find that but he did find his lost socks.

questions.text: When Sam said that the person who stole his item worked his way from A-G, where did Frasier say he was going to strike next?
questions.explanation:
Hs.

	Woody told Frasier that was a good way to think like a criminal. Frasier said, "Or like somebody acquainted with our alphabet".

questions.text: Who helped Sam get back his missing item?
questions.explanation:
Rebecca.

	At first Rebecca didn't want to help and said, "Why would I want to help Sam get back his book of great big bimbos" To which Carla replied, "Because you're the next great big bimbo he's going to call."

questions.text: The Final Jeopardy clue was: "Archibald Leach, Bernard Schwartz and Lucille Leseuer" What did the contest from Cheers say the question was?
questions.correct: "Who are three people who have never been in my kitchen?"
options: "Who are three people I've never met?"
"What were the real named of Cary Grant, Tony Curtis and Joan Crawford?"
"What were the real named of Cary Grant, Tony Curtis and Lucille Ball?
questions.explanation:
"Who are three people who have never been in my kitchen?".

	Cliff bet everything and lost even though going into Final Jeopardy he was in first place. He then preceded to make a fool of himself yelling at Alex Trebec. Woody and Norm sneaked out of the studio so no one would know they were with Cliff.

questions.text: What was the correct answer to the Final Jeopardy clue?
questions.correct: "What were the real names of Cary Grant, Tony Curtis and Joan Crawford?"
options: "What were the real names of Gary Grant, Tony Curtis and Lucille Ball?"
"What were the real names of Tony Randall, Jack Klugman and Penny Marshall?"
"What were the real names of Ted Danson, John Ratzenberger and Kirstie Alley?"
questions.explanation:
"What were the real names of Cary Grant, Tony Curtis and Joan Crawford?".

	Cliff said, "Be that as it may, those people have never been in my kitchen." Alex later goes to Cheers and sees Cliff and told him he was going to quit his job because he couldn't be sure there wouldn't be another case where more than one answer was correct. Cliff talked him out of quitting (of course Alex had no intention of quitting he just made something up to make Cliff happy).

questions.text: How much money did the person wager?
questions.explanation:
$22,000.

	Cliff actually wrote, "$22,000 big ones". Alex couldn't believe he'd risk all his money when he was so far ahead of the others.

a teenage blond boy.

	His name was not mentioned in the show. Sam asked him why he stole the book and the boy answered because he wanted to be a babe hound like Sam. Sam explained that you have to start out as a "babe pup". He then gave the boy some money and told him to "go get a decent hair cut and don't forget to tip the shampoo girl".
